intro: Keysseria gibbsiae, commonly known as the Gibbsia keysseri, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its unique, spiny stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. Due to its restricted distribution and ecological significance, Keysseria gibbsiae is considered a rare and endemic species.
